references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat gans on image synthesis
references.reason: This paper is foundational, demonstrating the superiority of diffusion models over GANs in image synthesis, establishing diffusion models as a leading approach in the field.
This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a fundamental framework for many subsequent diffusion models, laying the theoretical groundwork for the field.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP's introduction of a powerful method for aligning text and image representations is crucial for many modern image generation tasks, including those in this paper.

references.paper_title: Hierarchical text-conditional image generation with clip latents
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the effectiveness of combining CLIP with diffusion models for high-quality text-conditional image generation, which is a major inspiration for the current paper's conditional generation experiments.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper significantly improves the resolution achievable by diffusion models, enabling higher-quality image generation and impacting much of the subsequent work in this space, including the current paper which uses SDXL.
